whatHostingDoes.title: What hosting actually does
whatHostingDoes.description: It's simpler than you think. Hosting gives your website a home on the internet so people can visit it.

storesFiles.title: It stores your website files
storesFiles.description: All your code, images, and content need to live somewhere. That's what a server is—a computer that's always on and always connected to the internet.

deliversSite.title: It delivers your site to visitors
deliversSite.description: When someone types in your domain name, hosting is what sends them your website—quickly and reliably, every time.

keepsSecure.title: It keeps things secure and updated
keepsSecure.description: Good hosting includes security updates, backups, and monitoring so you can focus on your business instead of server maintenance.

whyHostingMatters.title: Why hosting matters for your business
whyHostingMatters.description: Hosting isn't just technical infrastructure—it's the foundation of your online presence.

reliability.title: Reliability builds trust
reliability.description: When your site is always available, visitors trust that you're a real, established business. Downtime doesn't just mean lost visitors—it means lost credibility.

performance.title: Speed affects everything
performance.description: Fast-loading sites keep visitors engaged. Slow sites drive people away. Good hosting ensures your site loads quickly, which improves user experience and search rankings.

scalability.title: Room to grow
scalability.description: As your business grows, your website needs to handle more traffic. Good hosting scales with you, so you don't have to worry about outgrowing your infrastructure.

whenYouNeedHosting.title: When you need hosting
whenYouNeedHosting.description: If you're building anything online, you need hosting. Here are common scenarios:

scenarios.title: You're launching a new website
scenarios.description: Whether it's a portfolio, blog, or business site, you need hosting to make it accessible to the world.

scenarios.title: You're moving from a free platform
scenarios.description: Free platforms like WordPress.com or Blogger have limitations. Hosting gives you full control and a professional domain.

scenarios.title: Your current host isn't working
scenarios.description: Slow speeds, frequent downtime, or poor support? It might be time to switch to hosting that actually works.

scenarios.title: You're building an application
scenarios.description: Custom apps, APIs, or databases need reliable hosting infrastructure to run smoothly.

hostingBasics.title: Understanding hosting basics
hostingBasics.description: A few key concepts explained in plain language:

servers.title: What is a server?
servers.description: A server is a powerful computer that's always on and connected to the internet. It stores your website files and delivers them to visitors when they request your site.

uptime.title: Uptime and reliability
uptime.description: Uptime is the percentage of time your site is accessible. 99.9% uptime means your site is down less than 9 hours per year. Good hosting providers maintain high uptime through redundancy and monitoring.

bandwidth.title: Bandwidth explained
bandwidth.description: Bandwidth is the amount of data that can be transferred between your site and visitors. Think of it like a pipe—wider pipes handle more traffic. Most sites don't need unlimited bandwidth, but good hosting doesn't surprise you with overage fees.

storage.title: Storage space
storage.description: This is how much space you have for your website files—code, images, videos, databases. Most sites need relatively little storage, but it's important to have room to grow.

whichHosting.title: Which hosting fits your needs?
whichHosting.description: We offer three types of hosting. Pick the one that matches what you're building.

linux.title: Linux Hosting
linux.description: Perfect if you're building a custom site, need flexibility, or just want a solid foundation without extra layers.
linux.details: Great for static sites, Node.js apps, custom PHP projects, or anything you want full control over.

wordpress.title: WordPress Hosting
wordpress.description: If you're using WordPress, this is optimized specifically for it—faster, safer, and easier to manage.
wordpress.details: Automatic updates, built-in caching, and WordPress-specific security. We handle the technical stuff.

joomla.title: Joomla Hosting
joomla.description: Built for Joomla sites—pre-configured, tested, and ready to go with the performance Joomla needs.
joomla.details: Right PHP version, optimized database settings, and one-click Joomla installation included.

items.question: How do I know which hosting type I need?
items.answer: If you're using WordPress, go with WordPress Hosting—it's optimized for it. If you're using Joomla, choose Joomla Hosting. If you're building something custom or aren't sure yet, Linux Hosting gives you the most flexibility. You can always switch later if your needs change.

items.question: Can I upgrade my plan later?
items.answer: Yes, absolutely. Start with what makes sense now, and upgrade whenever you need more resources. The process is smooth—no downtime, no data loss, and we'll help you through it if needed.

items.question: Do I need technical knowledge to manage hosting?
items.answer: Not really. Our control panel is designed to be straightforward, and we provide guides for common tasks. If you get stuck, our support team is here to help—real humans who explain things clearly.

items.question: What if my site goes down?
items.answer: We monitor all servers 24/7 and have automated systems to catch issues before they become problems. If something does go wrong, we'll fix it immediately. And if it's something on your end, we'll help you figure it out—no judgment, just solutions.

cta.title: Still not sure which hosting you need?
cta.description: Talk to us. We'll ask a few questions about what you're building and point you in the right direction. No pressure, no sales pitch—just honest advice.
